page.title: 01THE BREICH VALLEY
page.content: The area inside this grid is commonly referred to as The Breich Valley.It is made up of three villages namely Addiewell,Breich and Stoneyburn.The main stretch of water flowing through the area is The Breich Water. Although the villages are close geographically the people have never associated much.This is probably because Breich lies on a different bus route from the other two.In the case of Addiewell and Stoneyburn the 2 villages have long been rivals because they were in different counties until Local Government reorganisation in 1975. The population of the area is roughly 3500.
